sentences: Kell on kuus ja aeg on õhtusöögiks.
Me lähme kohta kus pakutakse head õhtusööki.
context: The word 'õhtusöögi' is the partitive case form of 'õhtusöök', which means dinner or evening meal. In Estonian, the partitive case often indicates an incomplete action or what someone has/eats/does partially. So 'õhtusöögi' would mean '(some) dinner' or '(an) evening meal'. It's used when talking about eating dinner in a general sense or having had some dinner.
